content.description:
Quality face climbing in a cool location. 

  Go up good holds to the left end of the right-rising dike. Continue straight up the face to a ledge. Move left to a left-facing crescent, then straight up to a ceiling. Break this a up through a second overlap to a short crack, and finally to a fixed anchor.
content.location: The start is the same as Last Swim Or Dive, which is on the face about 10' right of the huge Gunpowder Corner, below a right-rising dike 15' up.

content.description:
There are three hard sections on this great line. The primary feature is a narrow, right-leaning ramp that goes up the center of an overhanging wall -- the left wall of Gunpowder Corner.

 Three routes begin at the same location and share the first couple bolts. Go straight up to a shelf. (A closed project continues straight up here.) Traverse left over the void to a short right-facing corner, Up this, then continue left (1st crux) to a good no-hands stance below an overhanging wall. Instant Makeout, 11a, continues straight up here; you go right. Make a hard move right (2nd crux) to gain the right-rising ramp. Follow this up and right to its top, spectacular 5.8. At the top, step right, then straight up (boulder problem, 3rd crux) to a good shelf (sit-down rest), then up to a fixed anchor just below the top.

 You can lower with a 70m rope. The route is impossible to clean on lower, so it's best to have a follower.
content.location: Locate Gunpowder Corner -- the giant, right-facing corner with a chimney in it. Begin a few feet left of this at a large birch tree.

content.description: Make a couple of moves straight up on good holds until your feet are on the dike band (at the second bolt of Open and Shut). Traverse right past another bolt and continue out to the arete. Follow the arete all the way to the top.
content.protection: Standard ADK rack, a couple bolts, fixed anchor.
content.location: The Case Wall is made up of two distinct faces that meet in a massive corner/chimney called "Gunpowder Corner". This route starts a few feet right of the corner, directly below a dike band and bolt that are both 12 feet off the deck.

content.description: Climb up to a small shelf, then head left onto a bulge with a mail slot (first crux). Continue left and up onto a stance and prepare for the main event. Head up the steep headwall through the boulder problem (second crux). Pull around the arete to the left and follow the arete up some easier(and more run out) terrain to the top.
content.protection: 12 Bolts. Belay from trees-bring your partner up, as there will be lots of rope drag otherwise!
content.location: The Case Wall is made up of two distinct faces that meet in a massive corner/chimney called "Gunpowder Corner". This route starts a few feet left of the corner at the same place that On The Case begins.

content.description: Stick clip. Go up dirty rock in a right-facing corner. Move left into the overhanging crack and follow this to a fixed anchor on the right.
content.location:
This route is located on the right side (when facing uphill) of the steep gully used to access the base of the Case Wall. Begin below a seam that breaks through the overhanging wall.

 The gully is about 200' left of On The Case.

content.description:
Located downstream in Chapel Pond Canyon, this small--but quite tall-- wall is home to some historic routes. These are mostly overgrown and unclimbable in their present condition. There are a few routes, however, that are being cleaned up and are actually quite good. 

  The base of the cliff is rough, forested, and steeply-sloped with moss-covered talus and hidden holes. Not the best staging area. On the positive side, the routes top out on pleasant, open rock ledges with views. 

  For reference, this cliff is across and up canyon from the Haggis and Cold Toast buttress.
